label: FGFS101
info_overview:
FIBARO Flood Sensor is a universal, Z-Wave Plus compatible, flood and temperature sensor. The device can be powered using battery, 12/24V DC power supply or both. Flood alarm is sent to the Z-Wave network devices or additionally to any external system through opening a NC contact using the external power supply.

The device has built in temperature sensor that allows to monitor ambient temperature. FIBARO Flood Sensor is designed to be placed on the floor or mounted on a wall (in this case Flood Sensor probes should be extended using addition wire). The device has a built-in visual LED indicator and an acoustic alarm.

In addition, the sensor is equipped with a tilt sensor reporting tilt or movement to the main controller e.g. when someone has taken the Sensor from its original location. 

FIBARO Flood Sensor is sink-proof, which means it drifts on the water surface and keeps on sending alarm signal in case of substantial inundation of water.
info_inclusion:
1. Open the cover.
  2. Place the Sensor within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.
  3. Set the main controller in (security/non-security) add mode (see the controller’s manual).
  4. Quickly, three times press the TMP button.
info_exclusion: Quickly, three times press the TMP button.
info_wakeup: Quickly, three times press the TMP button.

parameters.label: Alarm Cancellation Delay
parameters.description: Additional delay after an alarm has ceased
parameters.overview: Additional delay after an alarm has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased

parameters.label: Flooding Signals
parameters.description: LED indicator and acoustic alarm deactivation
parameters.overview: Parameter allows for LED indicator and acoustic alarm deactivation in case of flooding detection

options.label: Acoustic alarm inactive, visual alarm active
Acoustic alarm active, visual alarm inactive

parameters.label: Type of alarm frame for 1st  group (FLOOD)
parameters.description: Command frame sent by the Sensor in case flooding
parameters.overview: Parameter determines a type of command frame sent by the Sensor in case flooding has been detected or cancelled

parameters.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 1
parameters.description: Value of the parameter specifying linking to association group no. 1
parameters.overview: Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes switch on / open command to devices from association group no. 1. In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified. Possible parameter settings.

parameters.label: Alarm cancelling or turning a device off
parameters.description: Allows for deactivating device turn off and alarm cancellation functions
parameters.overview: Allows for deactivating device turn off and alarm cancellation functions for the devices assigned to 1-st association group

parameters.label: Temperature reading Interval
parameters.description: Interval between successive readings of temperature in seconds.
parameters.overview: Interval between successive readings of temperature from all sensors connected to the device in seconds.

parameters.label: Insensitiveness to temperature changes.
parameters.description: Determines a minimum temperature change value (insensitivity level; def: 0,5C)
parameters.overview: Determines a minimum temperature change value (insensitivity level; def: 0,5C), resulting in a temperature report being sent to the main controller, according to the Parameter 10 settings

parameters.label: Alarm BROADCAST
parameters.description: Transmitting the alarm or control frame in 'broadcast' mode
parameters.overview: Transmitting the alarm or control frame in 'broadcast' mode (i.e. to all devices within range), information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network. NOTE: If the broadcast mode of information transmission is activated for a given

options.label: Flood mode active, Tamper mode inactive
options.overview: Flood broadcast mode active, Tamper broadcast mode inactive

options.label: Tamper mode inactive, Tamper mode active
options.overview: Tamper broadcast mode inactive, Tamper broadcast mode active

options.label: Flood and Tamper broadcast mode active

parameters.label: Low temperature alarm threshold
parameters.description: The parameter stores a temperature value, below which LED indicator blinks.
parameters.overview: The parameter stores a temperature value (def. 15C), below which LED indicator blinks with a colour determined by a Parameter 61 settings. By default the LED indicator blinks blue. NOTE: The main controller does not interpret negative numbers

parameters.label: High temperature alarm threshold
parameters.description: The parameter stores a temperature value, above which LED indicator blinks.

parameters.label: Low temperature alarm indicator colour
parameters.overview: Default is blue (0x000000FF). NOTE: A main controller interprets colours as a sum of it component colours value. Each colours value is a number from 0 to 255. Eg: Indicated colour = 65536 * RED value + 256 * GREEN value + BLUE value

parameters.label: High temperature alarm indicator colour
parameters.overview: Default is red (0x00FF0000). NOTE: A main controller interprets colours as a sum of it component colours value. Each colours value is a number from 0 to 255. Eg: Indicated colour = 65536 * RED value + 256 * GREEN value + BLUE value

parameters.label: Managing a LED indicator under standard operation
parameters.overview: Parameter determines LED indicator’s operation. Set to 0 turns the indicator off, saving a battery life

options.label: LED indicator doesn’t indicate the temperature
LED indicator indicates the temperature (blink)
options.overview: LED indicator indicates the temperature (blink) every Temperature Meas

options.label: LED indicates temperature continuously
options.overview: LED indicator indicates the temperature continuously, only in constant

parameters.label: Temperature measurement compensation
parameters.description: Parameter stores a offset value from the current temperature
parameters.overview: Parameter stores a temperature value to be added to or deducted from the current temperature measured by internal temperature sensor in order to compensate the difference between air temperature and temperature at the floor level

parameters.label: Alarm frame sent to 2nd Group activation
parameters.overview: (MOVEMENT_TAMPER / BUTTON_TAMPER) The device is able to turn on alarms resulting from sensor’s vibrations e.g. when the sensor is moved, or the TMP button released. 2-nd Association Group alarms are not cancelled.

options.label: Button and movement tampers alarm active

parameters.label: Visual and audible alarms duration
parameters.overview: The user can silence the Flood Sensor. Because the Sensor’s alarm may last for a long time, it’s possible to turn off visual and audible alarm signaling to save battery. The parameter determines a time period after which alarm will become “quiet” - still

parameters.label: Visual and audible alarms retransmit
parameters.description: Period after which an alarm frame will be retransmitted

parameters.label: Flood sensor functionality turned off
parameters.description: Turning of the internal flood sensor.
parameters.overview: Allows for turning of the internal flood sensor. Tamper and built in temperature sensor will remain active

options.label: Built in flood sensor TURNED OFF
options.overview: Built in flood sensor TURNED OFF (doesn’t change its state in the main

channels.name: sensor_binary
channels.label: Binary Sensor (flood)
channels.overview:
This is for the "internal" 3 pins of the device.

IF using an extension wire a different channel might be triggered
